items.title: All Terrain
items.description: All-terrain tires offer drivers traction on- and off-road, and are typically used by light truck and SUV drivers who want a tire that's able to climb rocks and perform on the highway.

items.title: All Season
items.description: Most common: Good handle on dry, wet or snow

items.title: Highway
items.description: Highway terrain tires are commonly used on light trucks and SUVs that typically haul materials or need to conquer highways and some off-road terrains.

items.title: Winter
items.description: For snow, ice, and freezing temperatures

items.title: Mud Terrain
items.description: Mud Terrain tires offer drivers traction on off-road terrains such as mud, dirt, sand, gravel, and rock, and are commonly used on CUVs, SUVs, light trucks, and jeeps.

items.title: All Weather
items.description: Combines an All Season and Winter tire traits for strong traction year-round

items.title: Commercial Van
items.description: Also known as cargo tires, commercial van tires feature a C at the end of the tire's size and are built with durable, long-lasting materials to help drivers as they haul packages in pickup and delivery applications.

items.title: Do not show electric vehicle optimized

header.subtitle: Consistently rated as excellent by 215-85r16 drivers
Most popular among drivers in PA
Most popular among drivers in PA

content.body:
### Shop LT215/85R16 Tire Size The “LT” in LT285/85R16 stands for Light Truck, and that’s what kinds of vehicles roll on this tire size. The LT285/85R16 is a tire size you’ll find on the older Ford F250, Ram 3500, GMC Sierra, Mercedes-Benz Sprinter and Chevrolet Silverado 3500 models. Most drivers use all-season tires thanks to their ability to perform in dry, wet, and light winter weather conditions, so check out the Bridgestone Dueler H/T 685, [Grabber HD](https://simpletire.com/brands/general-tires/grabber-hd), Falken Wildpeak H/T02, and Kumho Crugen HT51. Popular makes and models: 1980-1996 Ford F250
1994-2001 Ram 3500
1999-2006 GMC Sierra 3500HD
2014-2020 Mercedes-Benz Sprinter
2001-2007 Chevrolet Silverado 3500 Maybe you’ve got a light truck with 4WD and like to get into some rough territory sometimes; all-terrain tires might be the thing for you. Check out tires like the Toyo Open Country A/T III, [Yokohama Geolandar AT G015](https://simpletire.com/brands/yokohama-tires/geolandar-at-g015), Hankook Dynapro AT2 (RF11), and Nexen Roadian AT Pro RA8 to give your light truck or SUV extra traction off-road. Vehicles like the Mercedes-Benz Sprinter might need a set of commercial van tires to help it haul packages to and from different locations. Consider the Continental Vancontact A/S, [Toyo Celsius Cargo](https://simpletire.com/brands/toyo-tires/celsius-cargo), Firestone Transforce HT2, and BFGoodrich Commercial T/A All Season 2 to help support the higher weight and center of gravity of your commercial van. Whether you drive a Chevrolet Silverado 3500, GMC Sierra 3500HD, Mercedes-Benz Sprinter or something else, SimpleTire has a set of LT215/85R16 tires that meets your needs at a great price!

info.title: Did you know?
info.body: A reliable brand is the #1 ask for most drivers. Here you can shop all the most popular brands and discover new ones – all tested, ranked and rated by our customers.
